newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks up at noon on foreign buying.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks up at noon on foreign buying.

text.p: Pakistani stocks jumped at midday on Wednesday for the fifth straight session, mainly on foreign buying of select blue chips, and dealers said they expected the rally to continue as sentiment was positive.

"Foreign buying in blue chips has pushed the index up," said dealer Manochar Jamal. "Energy and fertiliser stocks are in demand." The Karachi 100-share index rose 26.82 points, or 1.92 percent, to 1,424.04 at noon. The index has gained 55.91 points in the last five sessions. Gainers beat losers 121 to 40. PTCL rose 1.95 to 27.65 and Fauji Fertilizer 1.75 to 71.75.
